meanings.definition: The ability to assess and initiate things independently.
meanings.sent1: She showed great initiative by starting the project without being asked.
meanings.sent2: Taking the initiative to solve problems on your own is important.
meanings.sent3: His initiative to bake cookies for the whole neighborhood made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her initiative in organizing the event was like a spark that ignited the whole community.
meanings.sent5: The student's initiative in studying ahead of time paid off during the exam.

meanings.definition: A new plan or process to achieve a particular goal.
meanings.sent1: The team came up with a brilliant initiative to increase sales.
meanings.sent2: Implementing a new initiative can lead to positive changes in the company.
meanings.sent3: Their initiative to have a pizza party every Friday was a hit with everyone.
meanings.sent4: The initiative to plant more trees in the park was a breath of fresh air for the community.
meanings.sent5: The initiative to start a recycling program at school was met with enthusiasm by the students.

meanings.definition: The power or opportunity to act or take charge before others do.
meanings.sent1: Seizing the initiative in negotiations can lead to better outcomes.
meanings.sent2: Having the initiative to speak up in meetings can make a big difference.
meanings.sent3: His initiative to grab the last piece of cake before anyone else was both bold and funny.
meanings.sent4: Taking the initiative in a race is like being the first ray of sunlight in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The captain's initiative to change the game plan inspired the team to victory.
